meanings.definition: A small round mass or lump
meanings.sent1: I found a colorful glob on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The artist molded the clay into a perfect glob.
meanings.sent3: The glob of paint on my nose made me look like a clown.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like globs of shining stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The glob of ice cream on the cone was melting quickly in the sun.

meanings.definition: To form into a round shape
meanings.sent1: She tried to glob the dough into a ball.
meanings.sent2: The children globbed the sand into various shapes at the beach.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally globbed the playdough into a strange creature.
meanings.sent4: The potter globbed the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent5: The chef globbed the mixture into small patties for frying.

meanings.definition: To cover with a sticky substance
meanings.sent1: The spider globbed the fly in silk.
meanings.sent2: She globbed the paper with glue to make a collage.
meanings.sent3: The child globbed the toy car with honey for a sticky prank.
meanings.sent4: The tree was globbed with sap, shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The baker globbed the donuts with chocolate icing for a sweet finish.
